Question
========

It examines how many people would answer yes when asked whether they ever feel depressed. The percentage who answered with "yes. answers is 28% from a sample of 350 randomly asked people. The researchers want to know if the percentage is greater than 20%. To that end they set the null hypothesis at H~0~: *p*~0~ = 20%. From what percentage can the null hypothesis be rejected when a significance level is used of 2.5%?

Answerlist
----------

* 24%
* 29%
* 31%

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 24%: Correct
* 29%: Incorrect
* 31%: Incorrect
